name: JobControllerClient
title: Google
Cloud
Dataproc
V1
JobControllerClient
description: The JobController provides methods to manage jobs.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: metadata
params.description: Default metadata to be sent with each request. This can be overridden on a per call basis.

params.name: exception_transformer
params.description:
An optional proc that intercepts any exceptions raised during an API call to inject
custom error handling.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dataproc"

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job+:
job = {}
response = job_controller_client.submit_job(project_id, region, job)

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Required. The ID of the Google Cloud Platform project that the job
belongs to.

params.name: region
params.description: Required. The Cloud Dataproc region in which to handle the request.

params.name: job
params.description: Required. The job resource. A hash of the same form as Google::Cloud::Dataproc::V1::Job can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: get_job
title: Google
Cloud
Dataproc
V1
JobControllerClient#get_job
methods.description: Gets the resource representation for a job in a project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dataproc"

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job_id+:
job_id = ''
response = job_controller_client.get_job(project_id, region, job_id)

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Required. The ID of the Google Cloud Platform project that the job
belongs to.

params.name: region
params.description: Required. The Cloud Dataproc region in which to handle the request.

params.name: job_id
params.description: Required. The job ID.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dataproc"

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# Iterate over all results.
job_controller_client.list_jobs(project_id, region).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
job_controller_client.list_jobs(project_id, region).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Required. The ID of the Google Cloud Platform project that the job
belongs to.

params.name: region
params.description: Required. The Cloud Dataproc region in which to handle the request.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: cluster_name
params.description:
Optional. If set, the returned jobs list includes only jobs that were
submitted to the named cluster.

params.name: job_state_matcher
params.description:
Optional. Specifies enumerated categories of jobs to list. (default = match ALL jobs).

If +filter+ is provided, +jobStateMatcher+ will be ignored.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Optional. A filter constraining the jobs to list. Filters are case-sensitive and have the following syntax:

[field = value] AND [field [= value]] â€¦

where field is +status.state+ or +labels.[KEY]+, and +[KEY]+ is a label key. value can be +*+ to match all values. +status.state+ can be either +ACTIVE+ or +NON_ACTIVE+. Only the logical +AND+ operator is supported; space-separated items are treated as having an implicit +AND+ operator.

Example filter:

status.state = ACTIVE AND labels.env = staging AND labels.starred = *

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Cloud::Dataproc::V1::Job instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dataproc"

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job_id+:
job_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job+:
job = {}

# TODO: Initialize +update_mask+:
update_mask = {}
response = job_controller_client.update_job(project_id, region, job_id, job, update_mask)

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Required. The ID of the Google Cloud Platform project that the job
belongs to.

params.name: region
params.description: Required. The Cloud Dataproc region in which to handle the request.

params.name: job_id
params.description: Required. The job ID.

params.name: job
params.description: Required. The changes to the job. A hash of the same form as Google::Cloud::Dataproc::V1::Job can also be provided.

params.name: update_mask
params.description: Required. Specifies the path, relative to Job, of the field to update. For example, to update the labels of a Job the update_mask parameter would be specified as labels, and the +PATCH+ request body would specify the new value. Note: Currently, labels is the only field that can be updated. A hash of the same form as Google::Protobuf::FieldMask can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: cancel_job
title: Google
Cloud
Dataproc
V1
JobControllerClient#cancel_job
methods.description: Starts a job cancellation request. To access the job resource after cancellation, call regions/{region}/jobs.list or regions/{region}/jobs.get.

examples.code:

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job_id+:
job_id = ''
response = job_controller_client.cancel_job(project_id, region, job_id)

methods.name: delete_job
title: Google
Cloud
Dataproc
V1
JobControllerClient#delete_job
methods.description: Deletes the job from the project. If the job is active, the delete fails, and the response returns +FAILED_PRECONDITION+.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dataproc"

job_controller_client = Google::Cloud::Dataproc::JobController.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +region+:
region = ''

# TODO: Initialize +job_id+:
job_id = ''
job_controller_client.delete_job(project_id, region, job_id)
